title: Home Values Are Getting Hotter in Georgia
text:
Thanks to low mortgage rates, it's an excellent time to buy or sell a home across the U.S. But what about in Georgia?

Is the state's housing market too pricey for buyers? Not-so-great if you've got a home you want to sell? Or just right — for everybody?

Home values provide some answers. They indicate that the market in Georgia is heating up, according to Zillow, though you might find vast differences from one city or one corner of the state to the next.

Current home values in Georgia

Home values have been rising throughout Georgia and are up 8.06% from a year ago.

Statewide, the median value for a single-family home — meaning half are worth more, half are worth less — is currently $191,800 , Zillow says.

Could you afford that? Let's say you want to buy that mid-priced home using a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage at this week's average interest rate, which is a low 3.69%, says mortgage company Freddie Mac.

With the 30-year mortgage rate at 3.69% and the median home value for Georgia at $191,800 , a representative monthly mortgage payment would be $881.74.

How the Georgia housing market stacks up

Sean Pavone / Shutterstock

Athens, Georgia, USA downtown at sunset.

More

Property values in Georgia are high by historical standards and are lower than what the typical house is worth nationwide.

The median home value throughout the U.S. is $229,600, which is up 4.88% from a year ago.

Zillow predicts U.S. home values will rise 2.2% over the next year, while in Georgia, they're expected to fall -0.64%.

Homes are going on the market in Georgia at a median price of $104 per square foot, versus $155 per square foot nationwide.

Are you looking to buy? Take a look at today's best mortgage rates where you live.
description: At a time of low mortgage rates, see if homes in the Peach State are a good deal.
